basics.name: Jean-Sébastien Renaud
basics.label: Back/Front-End Developer Student
basics.summary: I am in 3rd year student in Computer Science in CentraleSupélec, Supélec formation (high ranked French engineering school). My involvement in the association Supélec Rézo as a regular member, then as Secretary and then as President depicts my growing interest for computer science. Supélec Rézo allowed me to develop several skills among network architecture, information systems management, development, working with professional hardware or managing voluntary teams working on long term projects. Finally, I recently came to like web development as both a back-end and a front-end developer thanks to my personal and academic projects. I am therefore searching a 6 month end-of-studies internship, outside of France, in this field starting in April 2016.

work.position: Network Project Manager and Lead Front-end Developer
work.summary: The Student Gaming Network is a federation created in 2015 which gathers the gaming associations from many French universities, engineering and business schools. The federation also organize the Student Gaming League, an E-sport tournament for students in partnership with the ESL.
highlights: (Personal project) Design, development and launch of a showcase website with ZURB Foundation

work.position: Engineering Internship - Amadea Web application developer
work.summary: Amadea is a Data Management Platform for real time data integration and transformation based on Data Morphing. It is the base engine for several other application developed by ISoft such as Fraud Manager used in fraud control by banks and insurance companies. (Turnover 1.000.000 €)
highlights: Update of a demo application for Amadea Web (data mining and web based reports software) to select style classes to apply to a component
Adaptation of the personalization module to be reusable in another application which allowed a user to select preset components
Continuous reflection about possible evolutions of Amadea Web thanks to this update

work.summary: (School project) TrainingAdvisor is a platform that regroups all the international academic opportunities available for the students of CentraleSupélec and the feedbacks from those who have already been there. TrainingAdvisor aims at simplifying the access to information for the students and offering them the benefits of their predecessors experience and advice. The platform also make it possible to extract the main trends.
highlights: Design according to specifications from the international direction and the strategic direction
Development of a web platform with Symfony2
Launch in production of the platform for the end of the school year 2014-2015

work.summary: CyXplus is in the NDT (Non Destructive Testing) industry, and is constantly working at supplying the most efficient inspection equipment and software to demanding manufacturing industries. (Turnover 5.000.000 €)
highlights: Development of scripts in VBA to control and automatically generate files for the software design office

volunteer.summary: Supélec Rézo is the association that manages the internet connection and provide services (data storage, web hosting, ...) on the ContraleSupélec Gif-sur-Yvette campus for its 800 residents, for a total turnover of 25.000 €
highlights: Management of the association as Secretary and then President
Organized a hub for the Hash Code 2015 by Google France
Training of the new active members of the association
Changed the fiber connecting the campus for a higer bandwith
Administration of several servers and servicies (mail server, firwall, NAT, monitoring, FTP indexer, Steam cache)
Migrated the monitoring service from Nagios to Icinga2
Enhanced the WiFi coverage on campus by doubling the number of WiFi hotspots

volunteer.summary: The Student Gaming Network is a federation created in 2015 which gathers the gaming associations from many French universities, engineering and business schools. The federation also organize the Student Gaming League, an E-sport tournament for students in partnership with the ESL.
highlights: Organization the first edition of the Student Gaming League

volunteer.summary: Club in charge of video game activities on the CentraleSupélec Gif-sur-Yvette campus.
highlights: Animation and organization of regular events related to video games on the campus
Organization of the first Gaming Week-Ends on the campus
Deployment and management several servers for popular games

education.area: Foundations of Computer Science and Software Engineering

education.studyType: Preparatory class for the "Banque PT" selective exam
